contentfulPagePressRelease.title: HBKU Now Accepting Applications For The Promising Students Program

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Hamad bin Khalifa University (HBKU) has launched the new edition of the Promising Students Program.

Geared at Grade 10 students who attend Qatar’s independent schools, the program aims to encourage the enrollment of the brightest young Qatari school students at universities within Qatar Foundation. The program, which runs over the three-year high school period, provides participants with English language and testing preparation courses, as well as university counseling sessions.

HBKU is now accepting applications for the program. Eligible participants must be Qatari students of independent schools across the country with a class average of 80 percent and above, seeking admission to one of HBKU’s partner universities. Interested students need to fill in an application form that they can then submit to their school counselor or to the HBKU Student Services department no later than 30 December.

All Qatari students of independent schools who meet the application criteria can apply for the Promising Students Program.

More information can be obtained by contacting outreach@qf.org.qa or 55234741
